info.title: SwaggerHub Registry API
info.description:
# Overview
Use SwaggerHub Registry API to access, manage, and update the following resources in SwaggerHub, bypassing the web interface:
  * APIs
  * Domains
  * Integrations
  * Projects
  * Templates


SwaggerHub also provides the [User Management API](https://app.swaggerhub.com/apis-docs/swagger-hub/user-management-api/) to get information about organizations and manage organization members.

# Base URL
Use the following base URL for SwaggerHub SaaS:
    
    http(s)://api.swaggerhub.com

**Note:** This documentation is for SwaggerHub SaaS. On-Premise customers should use the bundled API definition, which can be found at the URLs provided below.

Version 1.29.0 or later:

    http(s)://SERVER/v1/openapi.yaml - YAML version
    http(s)://SERVER/v1/openapi.json - JSON version

Earlier versions:

    http(s)://SERVER/v1/swagger.yaml - YAML version
    http(s)://SERVER/v1/swagger.json - JSON version

# Authentication
Operations that update data or access private data require authentication using an API key. You can find your personal API key on the [API Keys](https://app.swaggerhub.com/settings/apiKey) page in your account settings. Send this key in the `Authorization` header when making requests to the Registry API:

    Authorization: YOUR_API_KEY

To test API calls from this documentation page, click the **Authorize** button below and paste your API key there.

**Important:** Keep the API key secure and do not store it directly in your code.
# Tools
In addition to calling the Registry API directly, you can use the following tools to interact with the API from the command line or CI/CD pipeline:

 * [SwaggerHub CLI](https://www.npmjs.com/package/swaggerhub-cli) 
 * [Maven plugin](https://github.com/swagger-api/swaggerhub-maven-plugin)
 * [Gradle plugin](https://github.com/swagger-api/swaggerhub-gradle-plugin)

get.summary: Retrieve a list of currently defined APIs, domains, and templates in APIs.json format

parameters.name: specType
parameters.description:
Type of definitions to search:
* API - APIs only
* DOMAIN - domains only
* TEMPLATE - templates only
* ANY - APIs, domains, and templates

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description:
The visibility of a definition in SwaggerHub:
* PUBLIC - can be viewed by anyone
* PRIVATE - can only be viewed by you or your organization and those that you are collaborating with or have shared it with
* ANY - either PUBLIC or PRIVATE

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: API or domain owner. Can be username or organization name. Case-sensitive.

200.description: A list of APIs, domains, and templates in APIs.json format

get.summary: Search APIs
get.description: This is a convenience alias for `GET /specs?specType=API`.

303.description: Redirect to `GET /specs`, with all query parameters preserved

get.summary: Get a list of APIs of the specified owner

200.description: A list of APIs in APIs.json format

get.summary: Get a list of API versions

200.description: A list of API versions in APIs.json format

404.description: The specified API was not found. If it is private, make sure the request is authenticated and the authenticating user has access to this API.

post.description:
Use this operation to create a new API or update an existing API by uploading its OpenAPI definition in YAML or JSON format. The authenticating user must have permissions to create or update APIs in the specified `owner` account.

The API name and version must follow SwaggerHub naming rules, otherwise the request will be rejected. Refer to:
 
 * [API name format](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/apis/creating-api.html)
 * [Version format](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/apis/versioning.html#format)


When a new version of an existing API is created, it does not automatically become the default version. You can use `PUT /apis/{owner}/{api}/settings/default` to set the default version.

### cURL example
Line breaks are added for readability.

    curl -X POST "https://api.swaggerhub.com/apis/OWNER/API_TO_CREATE_OR_UPDATE"
         -H "Authorization: SWAGGERHUB_API_KEY"
         -H "Content-Type: application/yaml"
         --data-binary @C:\work\swagger.yaml

**Note:** Use `--data-binary` (not `-d`) when uploading YAML files using cURL, and remember to specify the correct `Content-Type` header.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: API owner name (organization or user name, case-sensitive)

parameters.name: isPrivate
parameters.description: Whether to make the API private (`true`) or public (`false`)

parameters.name: version
parameters.description:
API version to create or update. If omitted, the version is extracted from the `info.version` field of the provided OpenAPI definition.

Either the `version` parameter or the `info.version` value must be specified, otherwise the request will be rejected. If both are specified, the `version` parameter overrides the `info.version` value.

If this API version already exists, it will be updated with the new definition (unless that version has been published - in this case the update will be rejected).

parameters.name: definition
parameters.description: OpenAPI definition in the YAML or JSON format. The content must be syntactically valid YAML or JSON.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force update

200.description: Existing API version was successfully updated

201.description: New API or version was successfully created

205.description:
This status is returned when updating existing API versions that use [API Auto Mocking](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/integrations/api-auto-mocking.html) with the "Update host setting" option enabled. Status 205 means the uploaded definition was successfully saved, and its `servers` or `host`+`basePath` values were automatically updated to point to the mock server.

The client can download the updated definition from SwaggerHub by using `GET /apis/{owner}/{api}`.

400.description:
Possible reasons:

 * Some parameter values are invalid, or the provided OpenAPI definition is invalid.
 * The specified `projectName` does not exist in the `owner` organization, or the authenticating user does not have access to this project.
 * Cannot create a new API because a domain with this name already exists in the `owner` account. Try a different name.

404.description: The specified owner was not found

409.description: Cannot overwrite a published API version

404.description: The specified API not found

409.description: The API has published versions and cannot be deleted

post.description: The new name must follow the [naming rules](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/apis/creating-api.html).

404.description: The specified owner or API was not found

409.description: An API or domain with the new name already exists, or the new and old names are the same

get.summary: Get the OpenAPI definition of the specified API version

200.description: OpenAPI definition in the requested format (YAML or JSON)

400.description: Could not generate resolved definition due to syntax errors in the definition

application/json.message:
Failed to read OAS3 definition.
Could not find components/schemas/SchemaName in contents of https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/MyOrg/MyDomain/1.0.0

404.description: The specified API or version was not found. If it is private, make sure the request is authenticated and the authenticating user has access to this API.

200.description: The API version was successfully deleted

404.description: The specified API was not found

409.description: The API version is published and cannot be deleted or it is the only version of this API

post.description: Creates a [fork](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/apis/forking-api.html) of the specified API definition and version. The fork can be created as a new API, or as a new version in another existing API.

parameters.name: forkVersion
parameters.description: Fork parameters

400.description: Some parameters are missing or invalid

404.description: The specified owner or API was not found

409.description: An API with the name and version you're trying to create already exists

post.description:
Use this operation to clone an existing API version as a new version. The new version will have the same YAML content but with updated `info.version`.

**Note:** Comments, integrations, and codegen options are not copied to the new version. The default version also remains unchanged.

201.description: New API version was successfully created

400.description: Bad request

404.description: The specified API or version was not found

409.description: The API version you are trying to create already exists

get.summary: Get the OpenAPI definition for the specified API version in JSON format

400.description: Could not generate resolved definition due to syntax errors in the definition

application/json.message:
Failed to read OAS3 definition.
Could not find components/schemas/SchemaName in contents of https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/MyOrg/MyDomain/1.0.0

404.description: The specified API or version was not found. If it is private, make sure the request is authenticated and the authenticating user has access to this API.

get.summary: Get the OpenAPI definition for the specified API version in YAML format

examples.application/yaml:
openapi: 3.0.0
info:
  title: Sample API
  version: 1.0.0
paths: {}

400.description: Could not generate resolved definition due to syntax errors in the definition

application/json.message:
Failed to read OAS3 definition.
Could not find components/schemas/SchemaName in contents of https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/MyOrg/MyDomain/1.0.0

404.description: The specified API or version was not found. If it is private, make sure the request is authenticated and the authenticating user has access to this API.

get.summary: Get comments for the specified API version

204.description: No comments were found for the specified API

201.description: Newly created comment for the specified API

get.summary: Get the default version of an API
get.description: This operation returns the version identifier, such as `1.0.0`. To get the definition itself, use `GET /apis/{owner}/{api}/{version}`.

200.description: The default version identifier for this API

404.description: The specified API was not found. If it is private, make sure the request is authenticated and the authenticating user has access to this API.

parameters.name: defaultVersion
parameters.description: An object that specifies the default version for this API

200.description: The default version was successfully changed

404.description: The specified API or version was not found

get.summary: Get the published status for the specified API and version

200.description: The published status of this API version

404.description: The specified API or version was not found. If it is private, make sure the request is authenticated and the authenticating user has access to this API.

put.summary: Publish or unpublish an API version

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: To publish an API that references _unpublished_ domains, this parameter must be `true`. Otherwise, the request will be rejected with status code 424.

200.description: Successfully published or unpublished the API

400.description: The API definition contains [standardization](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/organizations/api-standardization.html) errors which prevent it from being published.

404.description: The specified API or version was not found

424.description:
The API version you are trying to publish contains references to _unpublished_ domains. If those domains change, it may affect your API. To publish the API anyway, repeat the request with the `force=true` query parameter.

The response body contains a list of unpublished domains referenced from this API.

get.summary: Get the visibility (public or private) of API version

200.description: The response body indicates whether this API version is private (`true`) or public (`false`)

404.description: The specified API or version was not found

put.summary: Set the visibility (public or private) of an API version

404.description: The specified API or version was not found

get.summary: Retrieve the standardization errors for a given API definition

200.description: Returns a list of standardization errors for the given API definition

get.summary: Deprecated Get API Standardization errors and warnings
get.description:
**Note:** This endpoint is deprecated. Use the following new endpoint instead:
GET /apis/{owner}/{api}/{version}/standardization 

If your organization has [API standardization](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/organizations/api-standardization.html) configured, you can use this operation to validate a specific API version and get a list of errors or warnings with line numbers.

This operation checks for standardization errors only and does not return OpenAPI syntax errors (such as misspelled keywords) or YAML syntax errors.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Organization name (case-sensitive)

200.description:
An object that contains a list of standardization errors and warnings found in the specified API version. Error information includes line numbers, severity (error or warning), and error messages.
If no standardization errors or warnings are found, an empty validation array is returned.

404.description: The specified API or version was not found, or standardization is not enabled for this organization.

get.summary: Retrieve an APIs.json listing for all template versions for an owner and template

200.description: A list of template versions in APIs.json format

404.description: Template not found

post.description: Saves the provided template definition; the owner must match the token owner. The version will be extracted from the template definitions itself.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Template version to create or update. If omitted, the version will be taken from the `info.version` field in the definition.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The template definition

205.description: Template successfully saved, and should be reloaded

400.description: Template definition invalid

409.description: Cannot overwrite a template version
Template has published versions, and cannot be deleted

get.summary: Retrieve a template definition

200.description: The template in requested format (YAML or JSON)

404.description: Template not found

delete.summary: Delete a particular version of a template

409.description: Selected template version is either published or the only version, and cannot be deleted

get.summary: Retrieve a list of templates for an owner

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Owner name

get.summary: Retrieve visibility settings for a template

404.description: Template not found

put.summary: Update visibility settings for a template

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Private settings

400.description: Request body invalid

404.description: Template not found

post.summary: Create a fork for a template

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Fork version information

400.description: Request body invalid

409.description: Conflict with existing template

200.description: Lifecycle settings for the specified template

404.description: Template not found

put.summary: Update lifecycle settings for a template

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Fork version information

400.description: Request body invalid

404.description: Template not found

400.description: Invalid request

409.description: API, domain, and template with the new name already exist

get.summary: Return the list of comments for a template

204.description: No comments found for the template

post.summary: Update the list of comments for a template

get.summary: Get all projects that a user has access to
get.description: We don't support this operation any more. Use /projects/{owner} instead

200.description: All projects accessible to the current user

get.summary: Get all projects of an organization

200.description: Project belonging to the specified organization

403.description: Projects are not available in the organization's plan

404.description: The specified organization was not found

post.summary: Create a project in an organization

201.description: The project has been created successfully

400.description: Bad request. For example, some of the specified `apis` or `domains` do not exist in the organization.

application/json.error: Unable to create project. Some api or domain entries are invalid.

403.description: Projects are not available in the organization's plan

404.description: The specified organization was not found

409.description: A project with this name already exists in the organization

get.summary: Get project information

403.description: Projects are not available in the organization's plan, or you are not a member of the specified project

404.description: The specified organization or project name was not found

put.description:
Use this operation to update an existing project, for example, add or remove APIs, or change the project description.

When updating a project, the `apis` and `domains` lists _replace_ the existing ones. This means that to add new APIs and domains to a project, you need to send the `apis` and `domains` lists containing both the existing and new APIs and domains.

To add a single API or domain to a project, you can use `PUT /projects/{owner}/{projectId}/{specType}/{name}` instead.

200.description: The project has been updated successfully

400.description: Bad request. For example, some of the specified `apis` or `domains` do not exist in the organization to which the project belongs.

application/json.error: Unable to save the project. Some API or domain names are invalid.

403.description: Projects are not available in the organization's plan, or you are not a member of the specified project

404.description: The specified organization or project name was not found

204.description: The project has been deleted successfully

403.description: Projects are not available in the organization's plan, or you are not a member of the specified project.

404.description: The specified organization or project name was not found

put.summary: Add an API or domain to a project
put.description:
Use this operation to add a single API or domain to the specified project.

To add multiple APIs or domains at once, use `PUT /projects/{owner}/{projectId}`.

parameters.name: specType
parameters.description: Definition type - `apis` or `domains`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of an API or domain that you want to add to the project. Case-sensitive.

200.description: The specified API or domain was successfully added to the project

403.description: The projects feature is not available for the organization's plan, or the authenticating user does not have permissions to add definitions to this project

404.description: The specified organization or project name was not found

409.description: The project already contains this API or domain

get.summary: Get project members
get.description: To manage project members use the User Management API: https://app.swaggerhub.com/apis/swagger-hub/user-management-api

200.description: A list of project members (users and teams)

403.description: Projects are not available in the organization's plan, or you are not a member of the specified project.

404.description: The specified organization or project name was not found

put.description:
To manage project members use the User Management API: https://app.swaggerhub.com/apis/swagger-hub/user-management-api
When updating a project, the `members` list _replaces_ the existing one. This means that to add new members to a project, you need to send the `members` list containing both the existing and new members.

200.description: The project members list has been updated successfully

403.description: Projects are not available in the organization's plan, or you are not a member of the specified project.

404.description: The specified organization or project name was not found

get.summary: Get all integrations configured for the specified API version
get.description:
The returned information includes integration types, names, unique IDs, and enabled/disabled status.

**Note:** The following integration types are currently not returned: Amazon API Gateway Lambda Sync, Apigee Edge, Azure API Management, IBM API Connect.

200.description: An object that contains information about the configured integrations

404.description: The specified API or version was not found

post.summary: Create an integration for the specified API and version
post.description:
Use this operation to configure an integration for a specific API version. The integration type is determined by which object is provided in the request body (specifically, by the `configType` value).

For a list of fields that need to be provided in the request body, see the descriptions of the following objects in the "Models" section at the bottom of API docs:

 * `AmazonApiGatewayIntegration`
 * `AmazonApiGatewayLambdaIntegration`
 * `ApigeeEdgeIntegration`
 * `AutoMockingIntegration`
 * `AzureApiManagementIntegration`
 * `AzureDevopsServicesIntegration`
 * `BitbucketCloudIntegration`
 * `BitbucketServerIntegration`
 * `GitHubIntegration`
 * `GitHubEnterpriseIntegration`
 * `GitLabIntegration`
 * `IBMApiConnectIntegration`
 * `WebhookIntegration`

**Notes:**
  * The integration `name` must be unique among all integrations configured for the given API version.
  * If `target` is the YAMl/JSON definition, you must specify the `outputFile`.
  * If `syncMethod`=_Advanced Sync_, you must specify a non-empty list of either `providedPaths` or `managedPaths` (or both). If you are not sure which paths to use, use `providedPaths`=`["*"]`.
  * The operation does not validate the repository details and access tokens.

201.description: The integration was successfully created. The response contains the auto-generated ID of the created integration and its confguration (excluding the access tokens and passwords).

400.description: The integration configuration was invalid

403.description: The authenticating user does not have permissions to create integrations in this API

404.description: The specified owner, API, or version was not found

409.description: An integration with this name already exists in this API

get.summary: Get integration settings
get.description: Returns the configuration of the specified integration. Access tokens and passwords are not returned for security reasons.

200.description: Can be one of the following objects: `AmazonApiGatewayIntegration`, `AmazonApiGatewayLambdaIntegration`, `ApigeeEdgeIntegration`, `AutoMockingIntegration`, `AzureApiManagementIntegration`, `AzureDevopsServicesIntegration`, `BitbucketCloudIntegration`, `BitbucketServerIntegration`, `GitHubIntegration`, `GitHubEnterpriseIntegration`, `GitLabIntegration`, `IBMApiConnectIntegration`, `WebhookIntegration`

404.description: The specified owner, API, version, or integration ID was not found

put.description:
Updates integration settings for the specified API and integration ID. The integration type is determined by which object is passed in the request body.

The request body must contain a **full representation** of an integration object. If you want to update just a few parameters, use the PATCH operation instead.

For a list of fields that need to be provided in the request body, see the descriptions of the following objects in the "Models" section at the bottom of API docs:

 * `AmazonApiGatewayIntegration`
 * `AmazonApiGatewayLambdaIntegration`
 * `ApigeeEdgeIntegration`
 * `AutoMockingIntegration`
 * `AzureApiManagementIntegration`
 * `AzureDevopsServicesIntegration`
 * `BitbucketCloudIntegration`
 * `BitbucketServerIntegration`
 * `GitHubIntegration`
 * `GitHubEnterpriseIntegration`
 * `GitLabIntegration`
 * `IBMApiConnectIntegration`
 * `WebhookIntegration`

**Notes:**
  * The integration `name` must be unique among all integrations configured for the given API version.
  * If `target` is the YAMl/JSON definition, you must specify the `outputFile`.
  * If `syncMethod`=_Advanced Sync_, you must specify a non-empty list of either `providedPaths` or `managedPaths` (or both). If you are not sure which paths to use, use `providedPaths`=`["*"]`.
  * The operation does not validate the repository details and access tokens.

400.description: The specified integration configuration is invalid

404.description: The specified combination of owner, API, version, integrationId, and configType was not found

patch.description:
Use this operation to partially update integration settings for the specified API and integration ID. For example, enable or disable an integration, or specify a new access token.

Only the fields provided in the request body will be updated; other settings will remain unchanged. For a list of fields that can be updated, see the following objects in the "Models" section at the bottom of API docs:

 * `AmazonApiGatewayIntegration`
 * `AmazonApiGatewayLambdaIntegration`
 * `ApigeeEdgeIntegration`
 * `AutoMockingIntegration`
 * `AzureApiManagementIntegration`
 * `AzureDevopsServicesIntegration`
 * `BitbucketCloudIntegration`
 * `BitbucketServerIntegration`
 * `GitHubIntegration`
 * `GitHubEnterpriseIntegration`
 * `GitLabIntegration`
 * `IBMApiConnectIntegration`
 * `WebhookIntegration`

**Notes:**
  * `configType` (integration type) cannot be changed.
  * If updating the integration `name`, make sure the new name is unique among all integrations configured for the given API version.
  * If you change `target` to the YAMl/JSON definition, you must also specify the `outputFile`.
  * If you change `syncMethod` to _Advanced Sync_, you must also specify a non-empty list of either `providedPaths` or `managedPaths` (or both). If you are not sure which paths to use, use `providedPaths`=`["*"]`.
  * The update operation does not validate the repository details and access tokens.

parameters.name: integrationTypeConfiguration
parameters.description: An object that contains the integration parameters you want to update

400.description: The specified integration configuration is invalid

404.description: The specified owner, API, version, or integration ID was not found

delete.description: Delete an existing integration specified by its ID.

403.description: The authenticating user does not have permissions to delete integrations from this API

404.description: The specified owner, API, version, or integration ID was not found

post.description:
Use this operation to trigger an existing integration.

Source control integrations push to (not pull from) the configured repository and branch. You can optionally provide a custom commit message.

**Note:** Webhooks cannot be triggered by this operation, they are only triggered when an API is saved or published. An attempt to trigger a webhook will return status code 400.

205.description: The integration was executed successfully and the API has been updated

400.description: The integration encountered an error while executing. Check that the integration settings (such as access tokens) are valid.

404.description: The specified API or integration ID was not found

409.description: The specified integration is disabled

get.summary: Search domains
get.description: This is a convenience alias for `GET /specs?specType=DOMAIN`.

303.description: Redirect to `GET /specs`, with all query parameters preserved

get.summary: Get a list of domains of the specified owner

200.description: A list of domains in APIs.json format

get.summary: Get a list of domain versions

200.description: A list of domain versions in APIs.json format

404.description: The specified domain was not found. If it is private, make sure the request is authenticated and the authenticating user has access to this API.

parameters.name: isPrivate
parameters.description: Specifies whether the domain has to be private

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Domain version. If omitted, will be taken from the `info.version` field in the definition.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.description: OpenAPI definition of this domain

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force update

205.description: The domain was successfully saved and should be reloaded

400.description:
Possible reasons:

 * Some parameter values are invalid, or the provided OpenAPI domain definition is invalid.
 * The specified `projectName` does not exist in the `owner` organization.
 * Cannot create a new domain because an API with this name already exists in the `owner` account. Try a different name.

409.description: Cannot overwrite a published domain version

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If this domain is referenced from other APIs and domains, this parameter must be `true`. Otherwise, the request will be rejected with status code 424.

404.description: The specified domain not found

409.description: The domain has published versions and can not be deleted

424.description:
The domain you are trying to delete is referenced from other APIs and domains. To delete it anyway, repeat the request with the `force=true` query parameter.

The response body contains a list of APIs and domains that reference this domain.

post.description: The new name must follow the [naming rules](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/apis/creating-api.html).

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If this domain is referenced from other APIs and domains, this parameter must be true. Otherwise, the request will be rejected with status code 424.

409.description: An API or domain with the new name already exists, or the new and old names are the same

424.description:
The domain you are trying to rename is referenced from other APIs or domains. Renaming the domain will break the references in those definitions. To rename the domain anyway, repeat the request with the `force=true` query parameter.

The response body contains a list of APIs and domains that reference this domain.

get.summary: Get the OpenAPI definition of the specified domain version

200.description: OpenAPI definition of a domain in the requested format (YAML or JSON)

404.description: The specified domain or version was not found. If it is private, make sure the request is authenticated and the authenticating user has access to this API.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If this domain version is referenced from other APIs and domains, this parameter must be `true`. Otherwise, the request will be rejected with status code 424.

200.description: The domain version was successfully deleted

404.description: The specified domain or version was not found

409.description: The domain version is published and can not be deleted or it is the only version of this domain

424.description:
The domain version you are trying to delete is referenced from other APIs and domains. To delete it anyway, repeat the request with the `force=true` query parameter.

The response body contains a list of APIs and domains that reference this domain version.

post.description: Creates a [fork](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/apis/forking-api.html) of the specified domain definition and version. The fork can be created as a new domain, or as a new version in another existing domain.

parameters.name: forkVersion
parameters.description: Fork parameters

400.description: Some parameters are missing or invalid

404.description: The specified owner or domain was not found

409.description: A domain with the name and version you're trying to create already exists

post.description:
Use this operation to clone an existing domain version as a new version.

Note that the new version is not automatically set as the default version.

201.description: New domain version was successfully created

400.description: Bad request

404.description: The specified domain or version was not found

409.description: The domain version you are trying to create already exists

get.summary: Get the OpenAPI definition for the specified domain version in JSON format

404.description: The specified domain or version was not found. If it is private, make sure the request is authenticated and the authenticating user has access to this API.

get.summary: Get the OpenAPI definition for the specified domain version in YAML format

404.description: The specified domain or version was not found. If it is private, make sure the request is authenticated and the authenticating user has access to this API.

get.summary: Get comments for the specified domain version

200.description: Comments for the specified domain version

204.description: No comments were found for the specified domain version

200.description: Newly created comment for the specified domain

get.summary: Get the default version of a domain
get.description: This operation returns the version identifier, such as `1.0.0`. To get the definition itself, use `GET /domains/{owner}/{domain}/{version}`.

200.description: The default version identifier for this domain

404.description: The specified API was not found. If it is private, make sure the request is authenticated.

put.summary: Set the default version for a domain

parameters.name: defaultVersion
parameters.description: An object that specifies the default version for this domain

200.description: The default version was successfully changed

404.description: The specified domain or version was not found

get.summary: Get the published status for the specified domain and version

200.description: The published status of this domain version

404.description: The specified domain or version was not found

put.summary: Publish or unpublish a domain version

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: To publish a domain that references other _unpublished_ domains, this parameter must be `true`. Otherwise, the request will be rejected with status code 424.

200.description: Successfully published or unpublished the domain

404.description: The specified domain or version was not found

424.description:
The domain version you are trying to publish contains references to other _unpublished_ domains. If those domains change, it may affect your domain. To publish the domain anyway, repeat the request with the `force=true` query parameter.

The response body contains a list of unpublished domains referenced from this domain.

get.summary: Get the visibility (public or private) of a domain version

200.description: The response body indicates whether this domain version is private (`true`) or public (`false`)

404.description: The specified domain or version was not found

put.summary: Set the visibility (public or private) of a domain version

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: To change the visibility from _public_ to _private_ in case this domain is referenced from other _public_ definitions, this parameter must be `true`. Otherwise, the request will be rejected with status code 424.

404.description: The specified domain or version was not found

424.description:
The domain version you are trying to make _private_ is referenced from other _public_ definitions. Changing domain visibility may affect those definitions. To proceed anyway, repeat the request with the `force=true` query parameter.

The response body contains a list of APIs and domains that may be affected by this change.

TokenSecured.name: Authorization
TokenSecured.description: Specify your SwaggerHub API key found in https://app.swaggerhub.com/settings/apiKey.

filterViewers.name: filterViewers
filterViewers.description: Role as a criteria for filter list of notifiable users.

owner.name: owner
owner.description: API, domain, or template owner identifier (case-sensitive)

isPrivate.name: isPrivate
isPrivate.description: Defines whether the API or template has to be private

projectName.name: projectName
projectName.description: The project to add the API, domain, or template to

state.name: state
state.description:
Matches against published state of the spec:
* UNPUBLISHED - spec is a draft, a work in progress
* PUBLISHED - spec is a stable version ready for consuming from client applications
* ANY - either PUBLISHED or UNPUBLISHED

sort.name: sort
sort.description:
Sort criteria of result set:
* NAME
* UPDATED
* CREATED
* OWNER
* BEST_MATCH - by relevance
* TITLE - by `info.title`

resolved.name: resolved
resolved.description: Set to true to get the resolved version of the API definition. The content of all external $refs will be included in the resulting file.

flatten.name: flatten
flatten.description: If set to `true`, it creates models from inline schemas in OpenAPI definition. AsyncAPI definitions cannot be flattened.

lifecycleSettingsBody.name: settings
lifecycleSettingsBody.description: An object that specifies the new `published` state: `true` means published, `false` - unpublished

visibilitySettingsBody.name: settings
visibilitySettingsBody.description: An object that specifies the new visibility level: `true` means private, `false` - public

newVersion.name: newVersion
newVersion.description: An object that contains the new version number and other parameters. The version number must be in the format described in the [documentation](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/apis/versioning.html#format).

projectSort.name: sort
projectSort.description:
Sort criteria or result set:
* NAME
* OWNER

projectMemberList.name: projectMemberList
projectMemberList.description: A list of users and teams to add to the project

projectRequest.name: projectRequest
projectRequest.description: The project data. Properties that are not provided are set to empty values.

nameOnly.name: nameOnly
nameOnly.description: Return the project information excluding APIs and domains

integrationId.name: integrationId
integrationId.description: Integration ID (case-sensitive). To get the available integration IDs, use `GET /apis/{owner}/{api}/{version}/integrations`

integrationTypeConfiguration.name: integrationTypeConfiguration
integrationTypeConfiguration.description:
Can be one of the following objects:

| `configType` value        | Object |
| ------------------------- | ------ |
| AMAZON_API_GATEWAY        | AmazonApiGatewayIntegration |
| AMAZON_API_GATEWAY_LAMBDA | AmazonApiGatewayLambdaIntegration |
| API_AUTO_MOCKING          | AutoMockingIntegration |
| APIGEE_EDGE               | ApigeeEdgeIntegration |
| AZURE_API_MANAGEMENT      | AzureApiManagementIntegration |
| AZURE_DEVOPS_SERVICES     | AzureDevopsServicesIntegration |
| BITBUCKET_CLOUD           | BitbucketCloudIntegration |
| BITBUCKET_SERVER          | BitbucketServerIntegration |
| GITHUB                    | GitHubIntegration |
| GITHUB_ENTERPRISE         | GitHubEnterpriseIntegration |
| GITLAB                    | GitLabIntegration |
| IBM_API_CONNECT           | IBMApiConnectIntegration |
| WEBHOOK                   | WebhookIntegration |

For more examples, see the JSON files in this repository:
https://github.com/SmartBear/swaggerhub-cli/tree/master/examples/integrations

commitMessage.name: commitMessage
commitMessage.description: Commit message for source control integrations

ApiNotFound.description: The API definition could not be found

ApisJsonProperty.description: An API property. Has a `type` and either `url` or `value`.

description.example: This is a sample Petstore server.

User.description: The user who added a comment

active.description: `true` means an existing user, `false` means the user is inactive (for example, deleted)

id.description: The unique ID of the comment

created.description: The UTC date and time when the comment was added

modified.description: The UTC date and time the when the comment was last edited

position.description: The line number (zero-based) the comment is associated with. For example, if the comment is on line 7 in the editor, `position`=6.

replies.description: A list of replies to this comment

owner.description: Internal ID of the API owner (organization or user)

ownerName.description: The name of the API owner (organization or user)

owners.description: If the API owner is an organization, this list contains the IDs of the organization owners. If the API owner is a user, an empty array is returned.

members.description: A list of users who are existing collaborators on this API

pendingMembers.description: A list of pending collaborators - users who were invited to collaborate on this API but have not accepted the invitation yet

teams.description: A list of teams that collaborate on this API

invited.description: Reserved for future use. Currently, this field is always an empty array.

roles.description: A list of this collaborator's roles

uuid.description: Internal ID of a user or team

name.description: The name of a user or team

startTime.description: The date and time this user or team was added as a collaborator

version.description: The version identifier for the new version

private.description: Whether the new version should be public (`false`) or private (`true`)

owner.description: The account to fork into. Can be an organization or user name. Case-sensitive. The authenticated user must have permissions to create definitions in this account.

name.description: The name for the forked definition. Must follow the [naming rules](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/apis/creating-api.html). Can be the name of an existing definition, in which case the fork will become a new version in that definition, unless that version already exists.

version.description: Version identifier for the forked definition. Must follow the [naming rules](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/apis/versioning.html#format). If forking into an existing definition, this version must not already exist.

project.description: If forking into an organization, you can optionally specify an existing project to add the forked definition to.

private.description: Whether the forked version should be public (`false`) or private (`true`). If the value is not set, the original version's setting will be used.

published.description: Whether the definition is published (`true`) or unpublished (`false`)

private.description: Whether the definition version is private (`true`) or public (`false`)

line.description: The line number (0-based) where the issue occurs. If, for some reason, the broken rule does not include a line number, defaults to 0.

description.example: OperationId must be present and non-empty string

IntegrationConfiguration.description: Common configuration details for all integrations

name.description: The display name of the integration. Must be unique among all integrations configured for the given API version.

enabled.description: Whether the integration is enabled or disabled

AmazonIntegration.description: Common configuration details for Amazon integrations

region.description: AWS region where the API will be published

apiId.description: AWS ID of the API to update. Empty value will create a new API in AWS.

publishMode.description: How to update an existing API in AWS

basePathMode.description: How to handle the API's `basePath` value. Refer to [AWS documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/latest/developerguide/api-gateway-import-api-basePath.html) for details.

updateDefinition.description: Whether to update the API definition with Amazon-specific extensions and compatibility modifications

deploymentMode.description: Should be "on save". The value "never" means the integration is disabled.

accessKey.description: AWS access key. Write-only property. Required to create and update the integration.

secretKey.description: AWS secret key. Write-only property. Required to create and update the integration.

AmazonApiGatewayIntegration.description: Configuration details for the [Amazon API Gateway](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/integrations/amazon-api-gateway.html) integration

proxyToAddress.description: The URL of the backend endpoint to which API Gateway will proxy the requests

AmazonApiGatewayLambdaIntegration.description: Configuration details for the [Amazon API Gateway Lambda Sync](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/integrations/amazon-api-gateway-lambda-sync.html) integration

runtimeLanguage.description: The target runtime language for the generated Lambda functions

lambdaRole.description:
The default execution role that will be assigned to newly Lambda functions created by SwaggerHub. Must be in the `arn:aws:iam::{ID}:role/{NAME}` format.
Can be omitted if all Lambda functions already exist and you are not going to recreate them.

host.description: Apigee Edge Management instance URL. Use the default URL `https://api.enterprise.apigee.com/v1` for the cloud version of Apigee Edge. If using an On-Premise deployment, enter the URL to your Edge instance.

email.description: Email address of your Apigee account

password.description: Password of your Apigee account. Write-only property. Required to create and update the integration.

organization.description: Organization where the API will be saved

apiName.description: Name for the API that is going to be saved in your Apigee account

AzureApiManagementIntegration.description: Configuration details for the [Azure API Management](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/integrations/azure-api-management.html) integration

serviceInstance.description: The name of the Azure API Management service instance as it appears in the "All resources" list in the Azure portal

token.description: A personal access token for accessing the Azure API Management service. Documentation for generating tokens is here:  https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/apimanagement/apimanagementrest/azure-api-management-rest-api-authentication Write-only property. Required to create and update the integration.

urlSuffix.description: This suffix will be appended to the hostname of your API Management service instance to create a public URL for your API

apiId.description: A unique identifier that allows you to connect your definition to an existing API. If left blank, a unique identifier will be added using an extension, `x-azure-api-id`. This value will be ignored if a value exists in the definition.

IBMApiConnectIntegration.description: Configuration details for the [IBM API Connect](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/integrations/ibm-api-connect.html) integration

apiKey.description: IBM Cloud API Key, obtain a key via https://cloud.ibm.com/iam/apikeys. Write-only property. Required to create and update the integration.

orgId.description:
The organization under your IBM Cloud account to which you want to deploy your API. Can be specified by ID or name.

The organization ID is an alphanumeric string like `680ee27a0cf28d61b4e9a462`. The organization name uses the format `<cloudFoundryOrgName>-<spaceName>`, where `<cloudFoundryOrgName>` is your Cloud Foundry organization name changed to lowercase and with non-alphanumeric characters removed.

The easiest way to find the value for `orgId` is to start configuring the IBM integration in SwaggerHub UI. After you authenticate using an IBM API key, you will see a list of organizations in the format "CFOrgName (SpaceName) (OrgId)". The value in the last parentheses is the `orgId`.

Alternatively, if you have the [API Connect Developer Toolkit](https://www.npmjs.com/package/apiconnect) installed, you can use the `apic orgs --server apimanager.us-south.apiconnect.cloud.ibm.com` command to get the organization names that can be used as `orgId`.

apiId.description: The name of the API in your IBM Cloud organization to publish to. If left blank, a new API will be created when the integration is triggered. When specified, any existing API definition will be overwritten.

orgDisplayName.description: The organization display name under your IBM Cloud account

AutoMockingIntegration.description: Configuration details for the [API Auto Mocking](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/integrations/api-auto-mocking.html) integration

defaultResponseType.description: Response content type that the mock server will return if no `Accept` header is specified.

token.description: (For private APIs only.) An arbitrary bearer token that the users will need to send in requests to the mock server.

modify.description: Whether to update the `host`/`servers` in the API definition to point to the mock server. `modify`=`true` can only be used if the API is _unpublished_.

url.description: The URL to send the webhook to

lifeCycleEvents.description: Events that will trigger the webhook

additionalHeaders.description: Custom HTTP headers to be sent with the webhook. Use the "name: value" format for each header.

SCMIntegrationConfiguration.description: Common configuration details for source control integrations

branch.description: The branch to synchronize to. If it does not exist in the repository, it will be created based on the default branch. Branch name must not contain whitespace characters.

outputFile.description: Required if `target` is "YAML (Resolved)", "YAML (Unresolved)", "JSON (Resolved)", or "JSON (Unresolved)". Specifies the file name for the generated definition.

target.description: The type of code to generate and push to the repository. For the possible values, start creating any source control integration manually and check the "Generated API Code" values. Note that the available codegens for OAS2 and OAS3 vary.

syncMethod.description:
"Basic Sync" or "Advanced Sync". Basic Sync will manage all files and folders in the branch. Advanced Sync allows you to define which files and folders will be managed by SwaggerHub.
Note: If "Advanced Sync" is used, you must specify either `providedPaths` or `managedPaths`.

outputFolder.description:
The output folder for the generated code or definition, relative to the repository root. If this folder does not exist, it will be created. If the output folder is not specified, SwaggerHub will create files and folders in the repository root.
Use forward slashes `/` as path separators, but do not add `/` at the beginning.

providedPaths.description:
Partially Managed Paths: These files and folders will be created only if they do not exist. Existing files will not be modified.
Paths are relative to the `outputFolder`. Use forward slashes `/` as folder separators, but do not add `/` at the beginning of the paths.
`*` means all files in the `outputFolder`.

ignoredPaths.description:
Ignored Paths: These files and folders (if exist) will remain as is and will not be changed in any way.
Paths are relative to the `outputFolder`. Use forward slashes `/` as folder separators, but do not add `/` at the beginning of the paths.

managedPaths.description:
Fully Managed Paths: These files and folders will be completely managed by the integration. New files will be added, the existing files will be overwritten, and the files that are no longer used will be deleted. 
Paths are relative to the `outputFolder`. Use forward slashes `/` as folder separators, but do not add `/` at the beginning of the paths.
`*` means all files in the `outputFolder`.

AzureDevopsServicesIntegration.description: Configuration details for the Azure DevOps Services integration

organization.description: The Azure DevOps organization that contains the target repository

personalAccessToken.description: A [personal access token](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/accounts/use-personal-access-tokens-to-authenticate?view=azure-devops&tabs=preview-page#create-a-pat) for accessing the target repository. The token must have the _Code > Read & write_ scope. Write-only property. Required to create and update the integration.

project.description: Team Project which contains the target repository

BitbucketCloudIntegration.description: Configuration details for the Bitbucket Cloud integration

password.description:
Bitbucket [app password](https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/app-passwords/) to authenticate with. Write-only property. Required to create and update the integration.
This app password must correspond to the `username` account and have the following permissions:

 * Account: Email, Read
 * Repositories: Read, Write

owner.description: The owner of the Bitbucket repository to synchronize with

BitbucketServerIntegration.description: Configuration details for the Bitbucket Server integration

host.description: The Bitbucket Server host to connect to. Make sure to include `http://` or `https://` at the beginning.

password.description:
A [personal access token](https://support.smartbear.com/swaggerhub/docs/integrations/bitbucket-server-sync.html#token) for accessing the target Bitbucket Server repository. This token must have permissions for _Projects: Read_ and _Repositories: Write_.
Write-only property. Required to create and update the integration.

owner.description: The owner of the repository to synchronize with

GitHubIntegration.description: Configuration details for the GitHub.com integration

token.description:
A personal access token for accessing the target GitHub repository. You can generate tokens here: https://github.com/settings/tokens. Write-only property. Required to create and update the integration.
The token must have the _public_repo_ scope if the target repository is public, or the _repo_ scope if it is private.

owner.description: The owner of the GitHub repository to synchronize with

GitHubEnterpriseIntegration.description: Configuration details for the GitHub Enterprise integration

host.description: The GitHub Enterprise host to connect to. Make sure to include `http://` or `https://` at the beginning.

token.description:
A [personal access token](https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise/user/github/authenticating-to-github/creating-a-personal-access-token) for accessing the target repository. Write-only property. Required to create and update the integration.
The token must have the _public_repo_ scope if the target repository is public, or the _repo_ scope if it is private.

owner.description: The owner of the repository to synchronize with

GitLabIntegration.description: Configuration details for the GitLab integration

host.description: The GitLab host to connect to. Make sure to include `https://` or `http://` at the beginning.

personalAccessToken.description:
A personal access token for accessing the target repository. The token must have the _api_ scope.
Write-only property. Required to create and update the integration.

owner.description: The owner of the repository to synchronize with

id.description: Internal ID of an organization owner

apis.description: A list of APIs included in this project. The APIs must belong to the same owner as the project. API names are case-sensitive.

domains.description: A list of domains included in this project. The domains must belong to the same owner as the project. Domain names are case-sensitive.

line.description:
The line number where the issue occurs. 0-indexed. If for some
reason, the broken rule does not include a line number, default to
zero.

description.description:
The issue's description, human friendly. Pertaining to how the user
can fix it.
description.example: API title must be present and non-empty string

TemplateWrapper.description: A list of Templates. Template names are case-sensitive.

Unauthorized.description: Access token is not set or invalid

ApiNotFound.description: The specified API was not found

DomainNotFound.description: The specified domain was not found

ApiCommentNotFound.description: The specified API or comment was not found

DomainCommentNotFound.description: The specified domain or comment was not found

ApiCommentReplyNotFound.description: The specified API, comment, or reply was not found

DomainCommentReplyNotFound.description: The specified domain, comment, or reply was not found

CommentForbidden.description: The comment feature is not available for the organization's plan, or the authenticating user does not have permission to complete this action

IntegrationForbidden.description: The authenticating user does not have access to integrations in this API

TemplateCommentReplyNotFound.description: Template, comment, or reply not found
